oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PREPARATION AND CHARACTERIZATION OF A PBTIO3+PBO MIXED-OXIDE PHOTOELECTRODE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KRISHNA, KM
SHARON, M
MISHRA, MK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: solar-cell
electrodes
mixed-oxides semiconductor
solar cells
conversion efficiency
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A new PbTiO3 + PbO photoelectrode system for a photoelectrochemical cell has been prepared from a mixture of beta-PbO2 and TiO2 by solid state sintering. The crystal structure and surface morphology of the mixture were determined by X-ray diffraction and scanning electron microscopy respectively, and energy dispersive X-ray analysis measurements were used to establish the phases present. These studies reveal the photoelectrode as a PbO-rich PbTiO3 mixed-phase oxide with high tetragonality and a crystalline nature. Mott-Schottky plots and photoelectrochemical measurements, such as the action spectrum, I-V characteristics etc., of this mixed oxide were evaluated in 0.1 M Fe(CN)(6)(3-/4-) (pH 9.2 buffer) redox electrolyte. These investigations suggest that the mixed-oxide electrode exhibits n-type conductivity, a decreased band-gap energy and an enhanced absorption range in the visible region.
